image.altText: Two men kissing in front of a car.

props.synopsis: What started as a chance discovery of an old photo at a Dallas antique store has spawned a collection of more than 4,000 images of male couples, more than 100 of which are now on display in Canberra.

title.children: Trove of unearthed vintage photos reveals forbidden love between men

image.altText: Three uniformed police officers walking on a road blocked off with orange cones.

props.synopsis: In just four minutes, two men were stabbed in the chest and customers inside the Queanbeyan hair salon were left shaken.

title.children: Bikies allegedly sat waiting in hair salon before stabbing two men

image.altText: The surf safety message is going beyond "swim between the flags".

props.synopsis: Every summer, millions of Australians head to the beach and every year thousands are rescued by lifeguards or surf life savers, and even surfers or other bystanders.

title.children: Red and yellow flags can be confusing. Is it time to change them?

props.synopsis: Fast to build, eco-friendly and affordable: modular and pre-fabricated homes have been touted as a possible solution to Australia's housing crisis, but manufacturers and suppliers say changes are needed to reduce costs and meet demand.

title.children: Are modular homes the key to solving the ACT's housing crisis?

image.altText: Two people shopping in a homewares store.

props.synopsis: Outlet centres around Australia were bustling on Boxing Day, but just down the road, some small retailers were feeling the sting. It's a trend that could shape the future of the Boxing Day sales.

title.children: 'We won't survive': Small retailers missing out on Boxing Day sales

image.altText: Julius Jungerth

props.synopsis: Hundreds of coin collectors forwent the late-night revelry of New Year's Eve in favour of an early morning visit to the Royal Australian Mint in Canberra, hoping to get their hands on the highly sought-after first coin of the year.

title.children: New coin celebrates 60 years of decimal currency

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone scrolling Facebook Marketplace.

props.synopsis: Savannah thought she had taken all the right steps to protect herself while selling items on Facebook Marketplace — but that did not stop her from being scammed. Here is what you need to know when buying and selling via online marketplaces.

title.children: Facebook Marketplace and Gumtree are full of scammers. Here is how to avoid them

image.altText: A person scrapes bees from a board with a comb.

props.synopsis: A fast-spreading parasite is expected to devastate local bee colonies over the next two years, affecting commercial and backyard crops.

title.children: Half of Canberra's beehives could be wiped out in two years. Here's why

image.altText: Reading 5

props.synopsis: There are books from authors that would become household names — F. Scott Fitzgerald and A.A Milne among them — and books that are now banned in some countries. But what can we learn from what people were reading in 1925?

title.children: What a 1925 summer reading list reveals about us

image.altText: A pile of squashed coffee pods in a bin at Nowra.

props.synopsis: Between 10 and 20 per cent of the 3 million coffee pods Australians consume daily are actually recycled. Here's what's being done to change that.

title.children: Creative efforts to drive down thousands of tonnes of coffee pod waste

image.altText: A man on a bus is blurred in the foreground, while three policemen holding large guns stand outside.

props.synopsis: Myanmar's military is holding its first elections since overthrowing a democratically elected government in 2021. But as it aims to portray a sense of normality, signs of the junta's menacing presence are everywhere.

title.children: The parts of Myanmar the military junta don't want you to see

image.altText: shot from a chopper, cattle running through floodwater

props.synopsis: Floodwaters remain in outback Queensland as graziers start to tally up livestock losses. Major flooding is possible in the north-west, with king tides forecast on the east coast.

title.children: Flooded Queensland graziers to get $2m support as pilots muster stranded livestock

image.altText: Elon Musk holding his hands up to his mouth.

props.synopsis: Tesla sales have declined for the second consecutive year, with Chinese rival BYD surpassing it as the world's largest electric vehicle maker.

title.children: Tesla loses title of world's bestselling EV company as sales drop

image.altText: A full yellow moon above the Sydney Harbour Bridge at night.

props.synopsis: Stargazers will be treated with a supersized wolf moon for the first weekend of the year. Here's what to know.

title.children: Skies will light up again tonight — but this time, it won't be from fireworks

image.altText: Tony's Bakery banh mi Cabramatta

props.synopsis: A humble bánh mì appreciation group created by a Sydneysider has played a pivotal role in reinvigorating Australia's love for Vietnamese baguettes.

title.children: 'Bánh mì lover': Vietnamese bakeries go viral on social media

image.altText: A photo of a woman with burns on her face

props.synopsis: Rachel Dear has a serious warning for anyone using a gas barbecue after she suffered significant face and body burns while cooking on Christmas Eve.

title.children: 'I'm on fire': Mum's warning after face, body burned in barbecue explosion

image.altText: Two mugshots side-by-side of a young man with cropped hair and a moustache.

props.synopsis: The US Attorney for the Western District of North Carolina claims the 18-year-old suspect had planned to attack a grocery store and fast food restaurant in his hometown.

title.children: Man charged over ISIS-inspired New Year's Eve attack plans, FBI says

image.altText: Police at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A man was treated by paramedics but died at the scene following a shooting in Fitzroy.

title.children: Man dies after shooting in Melbourne's inner north

image.altText: Waves crashing on rocks at Coogee Beach.

props.synopsis: The identity of one of four people who died in a cluster of drownings on the New South Wales coast in recent days has been confirmed as a Sydney hairdresser and mother.

title.children: Sydney mother drowned trying to save son from rip in dangerous swell

image.altText: Steve Waugh brings up his century on the last ball of day two of the fifth Ashes Test in 2003

props.synopsis: With one ball remaining on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in 2003, Steve Waugh stared down a century and his own cricketing mortality before securing one of the most famous centuries of his storied career.

title.children: Two decades on, Waugh's last-ball century completes his perfect day

image.altText: Amanda pushes her daughter on a swing at a playground.

props.synopsis: While the exact number of pregnant women who are homeless in Victoria is unknown, experts say the outsized demand for specialty support services indicates more can be done.

title.children: Housing demand for pregnant homeless women outstrips supply, experts say

image.altText: Prawn trays sit in a store display

props.synopsis: After a year dominated by the algal bloom, SA's seafood retailers are breathing a small sigh of relief after some promising Christmas sales — but others in the industry have only just been given the all-clear to get back into business.

title.children: Christmas seafood sales a 'huge relief' amid algal bloom anxiety

image.altText: A sign for the mine at its entrance

props.synopsis: One man is in hospital and another is missing following an incident at a Central Queensland coal mine.

title.children: Rescue operations underway after coal mine collapse

image.altText: Naomi Osaka looks on at the United Cup in Perth.

props.synopsis: Just over two weeks from the season-opening major, former world number one Naomi Osaka reveals she is not at full health after contracting a viral illness over the Christmas period.

title.children: Osaka 'dealing with some health stuff' ahead of Australian Open

image.altText: A man with short hair looks neutrally at another man who's facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Ukraine's president has named Kyrylo Budanov, a legendary intelligence leader in the country, as the new head of his presidential office.

title.children: Volodymyr Zelenskyy names spy chief as new top aide

image.altText: An extreme close up of Donald Trump with his eyes closed and a grimacing expression

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says he regrets undergoing advanced imagery on his heart and abdomen because of the "ammunition" it handed his critics, but has once more defended his "perfect" health.

title.children: What we learned from Donald Trump's wide-ranging health interview

image.altText: Australia cricketer Usman Khawaja touches his face with his finger during his retirement press conference.

props.synopsis: Australia batter Usman Khawaja takes aim at his critics one last time as he announces his retirement from international cricket.

title.children: Khawaja hits out at 'racial stereotypes' as he announces Test retirement

image.altText: Australian Test batter Usman Khawaja looks to the sky as he walks off after losing his wicket.

props.synopsis: Before his debut in 2011, Australia had never seen a cricketer like Usman Khawaja and, thanks to his work on and off the field, he'll be followed by plenty more.

title.children: Khawaja's on-field brilliance pales in comparison to his true impact

image.altText: A man, woman and teenage girl stand for a photo with lines of other people behind them

props.synopsis: The North Korean leader's daughter, reportedly named Kim Ju Ae, has been making increasingly prominent appearances in state media, fuelling speculation she may be in line to be the country's fourth-generation leader.

title.children: Kim Jong Un's daughter visits state mausoleum, fueling heir speculation

image.altText: Figure skater receieves Australian Citizenship certificate

props.synopsis: Figure skater Anastasia Golubeva becomes an Australian citizen, just six weeks out from the Milano-Cortina Olympics.

title.children: Last-minute citizenship change paves way for figure skater's Olympic debut

image.altText: Jabiru sign

props.synopsis: The remote Northern Territory town of Jabiru has faced rolling blackouts since New Year's Eve, with no clear indication of when power will be properly restored.

title.children: Remote NT town in power limbo amid rolling blackouts since New Years Eve

image.altText: An illustration showing smog from Chinese factories juxtaposed with a bushfire in Australia.

props.synopsis: As China caps off a historic clean-up of its smog and air pollution, the clearer air is helping temperatures rise to new records. Now, researchers are linking that change to hotter and drier conditions in Australia.

title.children: China's anti-pollution crusade linked to Australian bushfires

image.altText: Xi Jinping in a navy suit and red tie clapping his hands and smiling slightly

props.synopsis: Beijing's new measures are aimed at trying to rein in an Australian surge and manage local growth, rather than a direct target on Australia.

title.children: China's beef tariffs aren't about Australia

image.altText: A man in a Brisbane Lions guernsey kicking a football

props.synopsis: The club said the 32-year-old had made the decision following a "challenging personal period".

title.children: Lachie Neale apologises for actions that led to marriage breakdown

image.altText: Lightning strikes

props.synopsis: Queensland's Darling Downs has recorded more severe storm warning days than any other region this season — and meteorologists say it is no coincidence.

title.children: Why severe storms keep forming over Queensland's Darling Downs
